TopicTitle: Give me a mission to do, And I'll do it.

Articles.Content:
Give me something to do, and I'll do it, full with pictures. Just some simple rules.

Current Mission: Land at the face of Duna, Return for bonus internet cookie points.

Current Stage: Landing at the face.

1. ONE REQUEST AT A TIME. I'll tell you when I'm open for request or not. I'll ignore your request if you fail to follow this rule.

2. It shouldn't be too hard, it should be doable for someone who has played KSP for about 3 weeks - 1 month. Also, NOTHING TO DO WITH PLANES OH DEAR GOD.

3. Don't make me install any mods, I'll use mods for it, but don't make me install some.

4. Oh yes, one request at a time. Did I mention that?

Refer to below to see whether it's safe to request or not

No Requests!

I'm going to do updates on this page regularly. Stay tuned. Time stamps are in GMT - 8

Post contains an extreme amount of images.

The rocket I've selected for this mission is : Cygnus V

Here's the rocket.

And the numbers..

12:49 AM - The rocket is on the launchpad, awaiting liftoff.

12:50 AM - The rocket has launched!

12:56 AM - Gravity turn

1:06 AM - A dangerously low orbit of 70km has been established around Kerbin.

1:06 AM - Transfer burn to Duna.

1:05 AM (Lol stupid savings time) - So this is what they call "Aerobreaking at Duna... No flames?"

1:14 AM - I have established a stable orbit with the help of aerobreaking. I decoupled the transfer stage, moved the Kerbal out of the return vessel and onto the seat, and decoupled that aswell. I'm now going to try landing at the face.

1:42 AM - Holy.. Such a beautiful Ike-rise. Beginning our descent.

2:36 AM - Oh my god! I'm actually going to do it

2:37 AM - B-b-b-b-ut... So... Close.. Going to try a second attempt

Edited November 4, 2013 by Specialist290
Fixed that for you :) Next time, you'll want to use the BBCode tags; HTML has been disabled for forum posts.

Land at the Duna Face.

Bonus...

Return to Kerbin.
Somewhat interesting idea. In respect to #3 though it would greatly help if you mentioned what mods you do have.

Land at the Duna Face.

Bonus...

Return to Kerbin.

Accepted. Working on it now.

Somewhat interesting idea. In respect to #3 though it would greatly help if you mentioned what mods you do have.

Oh yes, I should've been more specific. I only use mechjeb, some mods that add new rocket parts, and Kerbal Engineer Redux

Come on people, reading isn't too hard. Requests are closed for the time being as I'm limited to one request at a time.

New Mission, Finish at least 1 of the following challenge.

1) Master of EVA. (Minmus version).

2) Fun little challenge. Yet, you learn something. Mun edition.

3) Fun little challenge. Yet, you learn something. (Video Tutorial-added)

4) 33.1km Emergency Rescue on Jeb's Burger!

Edited November 12, 2013 by Sirine
I'll try limiting the amount of images I post.. Jesus. Is there a way to do spoilers? I'd do a imgur album but since I'm updating everything in real time..

Until such a time as we can get onto Squad's official website maintainer person (I have no idea what their post is actually called) to fix up security vulnerabilities in VB's php code, spoilers are indefinitely disabled as they can be abused to compromise the forum. Sorry :/

However, you may want to consider using http://imgur.com/ to create image albums, and have the album embed code put into your post instead of separate images. It will greatly reduce the amount of space you need

(Just remember that HTML code cannot be used on the forum. BBCode is all you can use; square bracketed code only. There's a guide here on how to embed entire albums into posts.)

Edited November 3, 2013 by vexx32

I'll try limiting the amount of images I post.. Jesus. Is there a way to do spoilers? I'd do a imgur album but since I'm updating everything in real time..

couldn't you just keep adding the images to the album? That's what I do.
Your challenge is making me go nuts

land on the mun with a two stage lander with a CM in orbit to return ( Apollo style) only the two stage lander is really a rover you can drive around and then jettison the wheels to return to the CM.

I actually just did this not to long ago so its relatively easy, the only hard part is shoving that much stuff in to a rover: EX a docking port, Rcs fuel/blocks, 1.000 or more DV, wheels, the whole nine yards I personally had to use a ton of part clipping, to keep the rover at an ok size.
